intro: Phagnalon schweinfurthii var. androssovii, commonly known as the Andros ovata, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters. This variety is noted for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
